intro: Wartmannia stillingifolius, commonly known as the Stillingifolius wartmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in small, raised bumps or warts, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Native to the tropical regions of South America, it thrives in warm, humid environments with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
